channel.title: Java!
channel.description:
I just got legacy rsps source ,but it keeps coming up " 'java' is not reconized as an internal or external command operable program or batch file
someone help?

item.title: Java!
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

Firstly, Do you have Java installed onto your computer?
If you any JDK or usually known as the Java SDK. Then find it’s update number by doing this

C:\Program Files\java
And there you should have 2 folders.
Jdk1.6.0_##
JRE

the JDK1.6.0_## is your update number.
Now right click on “Computer” and click on Properties.

if you are windows 7. Click on “Advanced System Properties”
If on Vista/XP. Then it SHOULD just bring up the dialog box.

Now You should see a button underneath the advanced tab that says “Environmental Variables”.
Click on that.
And I recommend you don’t do a System Variable, but just a personal one.
So in that first box, if there is no Variable called “PATH” then create a new variable.

Call it “PATH”
And in the variable Value box. enter this

This code if you had to create the new variable “PATH”

Let “##” be your update number.

This code if you didn’t have to create a new variable “PATH”

Let “##” be your update number.

And if you are familiar with this, then you know.

You cannot have this variable active if you don’t have(If you have) other variables that aren’t separated by a Semicolon(;).
Example.

Notice how I have my Java separated from my Visual Studio with a Semicolon? If you have more than one directive, you need to make sure that they are separated.

Yuh welcuhm.

Read full topic
